name: Microscope Automation
description: Microscope Automation is an automation software for a variety of popular microscopes, such as Zeiss and 3i.

name: ImSwitch
description: ImSwitch is a software solution in Python that aims at generalizing microscope control for flexible control of multiple microscope modalities.

name: Adaptive-imaging
description: Adaptive Imaging is a set of tools for adaptive imaging. The overall idea of this project is to adapt the imaging speed of a microscope to the presence of events in the images.

name: Event-driven acquisition (EDA)
description: event-driven-acquisition is a Python library for advanced microscope control routines to enable acquisitions to react to specific biological events of interest.

name: Microscope Gym
description: Microscope Gym is a new microscope control software under development.

name: Zeiss OAD
description: Open Application Development (OAD) for Zen BLUE software to control Zeiss microscopes.

name: Acquifer API
description: Acquifier API is a python package providing utilitary functionalities when working with an ACQUIFER Imaging Machine.

name: smartLLSM
description: smartLLSM is a pipeline for Smart Lattice Light Sheet Microscopy to image rare and complex cellular events.

name: Navigate
description: Navigate is an open source Python package for control of light-sheet microscopes. It allows for easily reconfigurable hardware setups and automated acquisition rotuines.

name: MicroMator
description: MicroMator is an open and flexible software for reactive microscopy.

name: Pycromanager
description: pycromanager is a Python library for customized microscope hardware control and integration with image processing. It works together with Micro-manager and Micro-magellan, or can be used as a standalone backend system for controlling microscope hardware.

name: pymmcore-plus
description: pymmcore-plus is sa library to control Micosocpes. It extends pymmcore with a number of features designed to facilitate working with Micro-manager in pure python/C environments.

name: Python Microscopy Environment (PYME)
description: PYME is an open-source application suite for light microscopy acquisition, data storage, visualization, and analysis. It offers a particularly comprehensive set of features for single-molecule localization techniques, but also supports many other modalities.

name: AutoPilot
description: AutoPilot is an open-source project that hosts the general algorithm for the assessment of image quality, an automated computational method for 3D mapping, and data-driven optimization of the system of light-sheet microscopes.

name: ShrimPy
description: shrimPy is a pythonic framework for high-throughput smart microscopy and high-performance analysis.

name: Python Microscope
description: Python's microscope package is a free and open source library for microscope control aimed at those who are building their own microscopes or want programmatic control for microscope experiments.

name: qi23lab-OPM
description: qi2lab-OPM I a library for control, reconstruction, and analysis code for multiplexed imaging using oblique plane microscopy (OPM).

name: exa-spim-control
description: exa-spim-control is a program for acquisition control for the exaSPIM microscope system.

name: DiSPIM
description: DiSPIM is a program for the control of the Dual Inverted Selective Plane Illumination Microscopy (DiSPIM) from ASI.

name: OpenSimView
description: OpenSimView is an open access repository provides all information for building a 2 detection and 2 illumination simultaneous multiview microscope.

name: mesoSPIM-control
description: mesoSPIM-control is n image acquisition software for mesoscale selective plane illumination microscope (mesoSPIM) light-sheet microscopes.

name: leicaautomator
description: Years-old attempt to automate Leica SPX microscopes

name: leicaimage
description: Handle Leica Matrix Screener experiment images. The leicaimage library is a modified version of the "leicaexperiment" library.

name: ExEngine
description: Toolkit for building microscopy hardware control. ExEngine is a flexible intermediary which enables mixing and matching of components from different frameworks within a single application.

name: LumaViewPro
description: Open source control interface for Etaluma microscopes

name: SpecPy
description: Python utility interface to control iMSPECTOR software, making smart microscopy in Abberior's microscopes possible.
